item.title: Report E-2024050354
item.description:
Report E-2024050354

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-21T15:12:18+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-16
  • City: CHICAGO HEIGHTS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding (2) crushed and leaking poly drums containing hazardous product, InterCoat® ChemGuard 320L Thor. The drums were shrink-wrapped together by the Shipper and fell over during transit as a result of inadequate preparation for transportation / improper blocking and bracing. This resulted in approximately 1-gallon of product releasing onto the wooden trailer floor in a 5’x5’ area. A Contractor neutralized the release with Acid Gator and overpacked the damaged drums. In total, two 55-gallon DF’s were generated for waste disposal. No storm-drains, waterways, or soil were impacted by this incident.

item.title: Report X-2024050672
item.description:
Report X-2024050672

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-02
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AUDITOR WAS HEADING TOWARDS HAZMAT PACKAGE WHEN HE NOTICED THERE WAS A TORN HOLE ON THE TOP OF THE BUCKET. RESPONDER WAS HEADING BACK FROM ANOTHER SPILL WHEN THE AUDITOR NOTIFIED THE RESPONDER ABOUT THE SPILL. RESPONDER ALREADY HAD THE REQUIRED PPE ON AND FOLLOWED DECISION TREE TO FLAMMABLE LIQUID. RESPONDER SUCESSFULLY CONTAINED THE LEAKER AND NO SPILLAGE APPEARED NEARBY.

item.title: Report X-2024050695
item.description:
Report X-2024050695

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-05-02
  • City: HODGKINS
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: RESPONDER SENT TO A LEAKING HAZMAT IN THE EAST PRIMARY. RESPONDER USED DECISION TREE AND RESPONSE SHEET TO CONTAINERIZE AND CLEAN UP THE SPILLED MATERIAL. PACKAGE AND MATERIAL WAS BROUGHT TO THE DMP CAGE FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. INFOMATION WAS COLLECTED ON ALL SIX SIDES OF PACKAGED, THE LIQUID WAS SOLIDIFIED AND BAGGED ALONG WITH THE MATERIAL, TO PROCESS THROUGH THE DMP. THE PROCESSED MATERIAL WAS THEN PLACED IN THE UNCONFIRMED DMP STORAGE AREA UNTIL FURHTER NOTICE.

item.title: Report E-2024050337
item.description:
Report E-2024050337

Identified by scraper @ 2024-05-20T15:12:17+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-04-21
  • City: PECATONICA
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Driver stopped at the end of the day and noticed liquid in his trailer while doing his post trip. The driver then notified our emergency response center at approximately 2300CT. The response team was dispatched to the sight arriving around 0200ct. They then dawned the appropriate PPE and began unloading the trailer to reach the container that was leaking. They found that the securement strap where it was secured to the wall of the trailer had rubbed a hole in the chime of the drum. The team then proceeded to place the damaged drum into a salvage drum and collected the released material with absorbents and then disposed of in the appropriate manner. The clean up was completed at 0800ct.
